answers.answer: Most likely it's nothing but they like to be sure.  When the uterus is measured lots of things can cause it to measure big that have nothing to do with the baby.  I went from measuring 21 weeks to 28 weeks in less than a month.  Baby still measured on track.  If the baby is becoming bigger that fast they worry about gestational diabetes which will be addressed with your flocks test.  They will also look for excess amniotic fluid which can signal some other issues (or can mean nothing also lol).  My doctor told me that when you measure big it's often bc of they way your internal organs addressed are situated (like your intestines) and push your uterus.  The ultrasound lady also said sometimes it's just how the baby is laying that can cause you to measure big.  They will most likely not change your due date this late in the pregnancy although if baby is getting too big they may recommend earlier delivery.
I said glucose test sorry my phone. CHanged it into flocks for some reason lol.

question: Hi!  At my last appointment (I was 24 weeks) they said my belly was measuring big so they set me up for an ultrasound at 30 weeks.  Just wondering if this means my due date could be earlier than originally set for April 9th... Or what else it could mean?  I'm not a skinny person to begin with,  I've got a little extra fluff but not super big... Maybe that causes me to measure big?  I have glucose test this Thursday when I'm 28 weeks followed by an appt with my obgyn.  I had a glucose test at 14 weeks and all was good.
title: Measuring big?
